Class Entity

java.lang.Object
gamePackages.entities.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Monster, Player
public class Entity extends Object
Represents a generic entity in the game, serving as a base class for specific entities such as players or monsters. This class provides attributes and methods for managing an entity's state, position, animations, interactions, collisions, health, and combat-related properties.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity()
      Default constructor.

    • Entity

      public Entity(String spritePath, float posX, float posY, int width, int height, float maxHealth)
      Constructs an entity with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      spritePath - The path to the sprite representing the entity.
      posX - The x-coordinate of the entity's position.
      posY - The y-coordinate of the entity's position.
      width - The width of the entity.
      height - The height of the entity.
      maxHealth - The maximum health of the entity.

  • Method Details

    • heal

      public void heal(float healAmount)
      Heals the entity by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      healAmount - The amount of health to restore. If the healed amount exceeds the entity's maximum health, the health is capped at the maximum.

    • upMaxHealth

      public void upMaxHealth(float maxHealth)
      Increases the entity's maximum health and adjusts the current health accordingly.
      Parameters:
      maxHealth - The amount to add to the entity's maximum health. This method adds the specified value to both the maximum health and current health of the entity.

    • attack

      public void attack(List<Monster> victims)
      Performs an attack on a list of potential victims.
      Parameters:
      victims - The list of entities to check for attack collisions. This method checks for overlaps between the entity's attack rectangle and the collision rectangles of the victims. If an overlap is detected, the victim takes damage.

    • attack

      public void attack(Entity victim)
      Performs an attack on a single victim.
      Parameters:
      victim - The entity to attack. This method applies damage to the specified victim.

    • checkPlayerDetection

      public void checkPlayerDetection(Entity player)
      Checks whether the player is detected within the entity's detection range.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity to check. This method sets the `playerDetected` flag to true if the player's center coordinates are within the detection circle of the entity.

    • updateAttackRectanglePosition

      public void updateAttackRectanglePosition(String direction)
      Updates the position of the attack rectangle based on the specified attack direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the attack. Possible values: - "UpAttack" moves the rectangle above the entity. - "DownAttack" moves the rectangle below the entity. - "LeftAttack" moves the rectangle to the left of the entity. - "RightAttack" moves the rectangle to the right of the entity.

    • takeDamages

      public void takeDamages(float damageAmount)
      Applies damage to the entity and updates its state accordingly.
      Parameters:
      damageAmount - The amount of damage to apply. This method reduces the entity's health by the specified damage amount, accounting for damage reduction. If the health drops to zero or below, the entity's health is set to zero. The method also resets the hit animation timer and sets the hit detection flag.

    • doDamage

      public void doDamage(Entity entity)
      Inflicts damage on the specified entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to receive the damage. This method applies damage to the target entity, considering the attacker's damage buff. If the attacker has no damage buff, a default damage value of 1 is applied.

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the entity's position and recalculates associated attributes. This method: - Updates the center coordinates of the entity. - Adjusts the position of the sprite and collision-related rectangles and circles. - Ensures all components are synchronized with the current position.

    • initMoveCommands

      public void initMoveCommands()
      Initializes movement commands and maps them to corresponding movement methods. This method creates a mapping of movement directions (e.g., "Up", "Down", "Left", "Right") to their respective methods using method references.

    • goTop

      public void goTop(float delta)
      Moves the entity upward.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's Y position and sets the last movement action to "Up".

    • goBottom

      public void goBottom(float delta)
      Moves the entity downward.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's Y position and sets the last movement action to "Down".

    • goLeft

      public void goLeft(float delta)
      Moves the entity to the left.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X position and sets the last movement action to "Left".

    • goRight

      public void goRight(float delta)
      Moves the entity to the right.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X position and sets the last movement action to "Right".

    • goTopLeft

      public void goTopLeft(float delta)
      Moves the entity diagonally upward and to the left.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X and Y positions using a diagonal direction vector and sets the last movement action to "UpLeft".

    • goTopRight

      public void goTopRight(float delta)
      Moves the entity diagonally upward and to the right.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X and Y positions using a diagonal direction vector and sets the last movement action to "UpRight".

    • goBottomLeft

      public void goBottomLeft(float delta)
      Moves the entity diagonally downward and to the left.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X and Y positions using a diagonal direction vector and sets the last movement action to "DownLeft".

    • goBottomRight

      public void goBottomRight(float delta)
      Moves the entity diagonally downward and to the right.
      Parameters:
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used to calculate movement distance. Updates the entity's X and Y positions using a diagonal direction vector and sets the last movement action to "DownRight".

    • punch

      public void punch(String direction)
      Initiates a punch action in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction of the punch (e.g., "UpAttack", "DownAttack", etc.). This method sets the entity to an attack state, resets the animation timing, and updates the current animation and movement action to reflect the punch direction.

    • resetAttack

      public void resetAttack()
      Resets the attack state if the attack animation has completed. If the elapsed animation time exceeds the reset attack timing, the entity's attack state is set to false, and the animation is reset to "Idle".

    • entityRender

      public void entityRender(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, float delta)
      Renders the entity, updating its animations and attack state.
      Parameters:
      batch - The SpriteBatch used to draw the entity.
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used for animation timing. This method: - Updates the elapsed animation time. - Resets the attack state if needed. - Draws the entity's current animation frame. - Renders the hit animation if the entity has been hit.

    • renderHitAnimation

      protected void renderHitAnimation(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch, float delta)
      Renders the hit animation if the entity has been recently hit.
      Parameters:
      batch - The SpriteBatch used to draw the animation.
      delta - Time elapsed since the last frame, used for animation timing. This method: - Draws the hit animation sprite if the hit animation timer is active. - Increments the hit animation timer. - Resets the hit detection flag once the animation completes.

    • initAnimations

      public void initAnimations(String spritePath)
      Initializes the entity's animations using the specified sprite path.
      Parameters:
      spritePath - The path to the sprite sheet used for animations. This method: - Initializes the animation dictionary. - Sets up the idle animation and sets it as the default animation. - Populates the animation list with the idle animation.

    • initAnimationsList

      public void initAnimationsList()
      Initializes the animation list for the entity. This method creates an empty `HashMap` to store animations mapped by their names.

    • initAnimationsDico

      public void initAnimationsDico()
      Initializes the animation dictionary for the entity. This method creates an empty `HashMap` to categorize animations by states and actions.

    • initShapeRenderer

      public void initShapeRenderer()
      Initializes the shape renderer for the entity. This method creates a new `ShapeRenderer` instance, used for debugging or rendering visual shapes.

    • initCollisionRectangle

      public void initCollisionRectangle()
      Initializes the collision rectangle for the entity. This method creates a new `Rectangle` positioned at the entity's coordinates with the entity's width and half of its height.

    • initInteractionRectangle

      public void initInteractionRectangle()
      Initializes the interaction rectangle for the entity. This method creates a new `Rectangle` positioned at the entity's coordinates with the entity's full width and height.

    • initDetectionCircle

      public void initDetectionCircle()
      Initializes the detection circle for the entity. This method creates a new `Circle` centered at the entity's position with the specified detection radius.

    • initAttackRectangle

      public void initAttackRectangle()
      Initializes the attack rectangle for the entity. This method creates a new `Rectangle` positioned at the entity's coordinates with the specified melee attack range.

    • setSprite

      public void setSprite(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion textureRegion)
      Sets the sprite for the entity using the specified texture region.
      Parameters:
      textureRegion - The texture region to use for the sprite. This method creates a new `Sprite` from the given texture region and positions it at the entity's coordinates.

    • setIdleAnimation

      public void setIdleAnimation(String spritePath)
      Sets the idle animation for the entity using the specified sprite path.
      Parameters:
      spritePath - The path to the sprite sheet for the idle animation. This method attempts to create a new `AnimationManager` for the idle animation. If an error occurs, a default sprite sheet is used as a fallback.

    • setAnimation

      public void setAnimation(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Animation<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion> animation)
      Sets the current animation for the entity.
      Parameters:
      animation - The animation to set as the current animation.

    • setLastMovementAction

      Parameters:
      MovementAction - The name of the last movement action (e.g., "Idle", "Up", "Down").

      Sets the current animation name for the entity.
      Parameters:
      animationName - The name of the animation to set (e.g., "Idle", "Walk", "Attack").

    • setOnIdleState

      public void setOnIdleState()
      Sets the entity's state to idle. This method sets the last movement action and animation name to "Idle".
